Application: Used for red dyes in textiles; first natural dye to be synthetically duplicated in 1868. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alizarin]
Provided blue dye for textiles; synthetic indigo introduced in the late 19th century. [https://thebiologist.rsb.org.uk/biologist-features/to-dye-for]
First synthetic dye discovered in 1856; used for purple coloring in textiles. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mauveine]
Introduced in 1859; provided vibrant magenta color for textiles. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Synthetic_colorant]
Synthesized in 1861; used for violet to blue shades in textiles. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Synthetic_colorant]
Developed in 1879; imparted bright green color to textiles. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Synthetic_colorant]
Synthesized in 1887; known for bright pink to red fluorescence; used in textiles and later in fluorescence microscopy. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Synthetic_colorant]
